availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Logan McNary (Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Maria L. Flournoy McNary in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on May 16, 1833. Father of Hugh F. McNary, Anne E. McNary, Mary L. McNary, Lucy Jane McNary, and Walter Scott McNary. Physician in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Physician in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 344B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 778-79.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 37.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 223A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 36.
"Dr. Thomas Logan McNary (1805-1874)," Find A Grave, Memorial #18628392, accessed May 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18628392.
